premise_source_doc_sentence: Judd Apatow  (  -LSB- ˈæpətaʊ -RSB- born December 6 , 1967  )  is an American film producer , writer , director , actor , and comedian .

claim: Judd Apatow produced a Broadway show.
premise_source_doc_sentence: He is the founder of Apatow Productions , through which he produced and developed the television series Freaks and Geeks , Undeclared , Girls , Love , Crashing and directed the films The 40-Year-Old Virgin  (  2005  )  , Knocked Up  (  2007  )  , Funny People  (  2009  )  , This Is 40  (  2012  )  , and Trainwreck  (  2015  )  .

claim: Judd Apatow produced a Broadway show.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Apatow 's work has won numerous awards including a Primetime Emmy Award  (  for The Ben Stiller Show  )  , a Hollywood Comedy Award , and an AFI Award for Bridesmaids  (  2011  )  .

claim: Judd Apatow produced a Broadway show.
premise_source_doc_sentence: His films have also been nominated for Grammy Awards , PGA Awards , Golden Globe Awards , and Academy Awards .

claim: Judd Apatow produced a Broadway show.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Also known for producing hit films such as The Cable Guy  (  1996  )  , Anchorman : The Legend of Ron Burgundy  (  2004  )  , Talladega Nights : The Ballad of Ricky Bobby  (  2006  )  , Superbad  (  2007  )  , Forgetting Sarah Marshall  (  2008  )  , Step Brothers  (  2008  )  , Pineapple Express  (  2008  )  , Get Him to the Greek  (  2010  )  , Bridesmaids  (  2011  )  , The Five-Year Engagement  (  2012  )  , and Anchorman 2 : The Legend Continues  (  2013  )  .

claim: Judd Apatow produced a Broadway show.
premise_source_doc_sentence: He is best known as a musician for his song `` Heart of Mine '' in the movie Keeping the Faith , his song score for the 2006 film Down in the Valley , and for co-writing the Dracula puppet musical finale , `` A Taste for Love '' , in the Judd Apatow produced film , Forgetting Sarah Marshall .
